title: How to learn Flask
content: Flask is a micro  written in . It is classified as a  because it does not require particular tools or libraries. It has no  abstraction layer, form validation, or any other components where pre-existing third-party libraries provide common functions. However, Flask supports extensions that can add application features as if they were implemented in Flask itself. Extensions exist for , form validation, upload handling, various open authentication technologies and several common framework related tools.
